meanings.definition: Administering an anesthetic to numb or put to sleep
meanings.sent1: The dentist was anesthetizing the patient before the procedure.
meanings.sent2: The doctor will be anesthetizing the patient for surgery tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: The anesthetizing process made the patient feel like they were floating on a cloud.
meanings.sent4: The anesthetizing effect slowly enveloped the patient, easing their pain.
meanings.sent5: The anesthetizing injection quickly took effect, calming the patient's nerves.

meanings.definition: Causing someone to become unconscious or insensitive
meanings.sent1: The anesthetizing medication made the patient fall into a deep sleep.
meanings.sent2: The anesthetizing gas rendered the patient unconscious during the operation.
meanings.sent3: The anesthetizing sensation left the patient feeling like a sleepy bear.
meanings.sent4: The anesthetizing power of the drug was so strong, it felt like a magic spell.
meanings.sent5: The anesthetizing effect was like a gentle lullaby, soothing the patient into dreamland.

meanings.definition: Making someone feel numb or unresponsive
meanings.sent1: The anesthetizing cream left the skin feeling completely numb.
meanings.sent2: The anesthetizing injection caused the area to become unresponsive to pain.
meanings.sent3: The anesthetizing sensation was like wearing a cozy blanket on the skin.
meanings.sent4: The anesthetizing effect was so strong, it felt like a shield against discomfort.
meanings.sent5: The anesthetizing spray worked like magic, making the skin feel pleasantly numb.
